# Data exploration and visualization practice
Here, we will explore how to use GGally and skimr for data exploration and visualization. 

## Data exploration
Use the skimr package to explore the built-in diamonds dataset 

```{r}
library(skimr)
library(tidyverse)
str(diamonds)

#explore
names(diamonds)
dim(diamonds)
summary(diamonds)
head(diamonds)
tail(diamonds)
str(diamonds)
skimr::skim(diamonds)



```

## Data visualizations
Now, we will use GGally paired with ggplot to visualize our data. 
```{r}
GGally::ggpairs(diamonds)
diamonds %>% ggplot(aes(x = price, y = carat)) + geom_point()


```


```{r}
diamonds %>% ggplot(aes(x = carat)) + geom_histogram()


diamonds %>% ggplot(aes(x = clarity, y = price)) + geom_boxplot()



```
